latestVersion.restrictions:
The ESS Data Archive Team at NSD has given permission to distribute these imputed and recoded data sets. The original ESS conditions of use apply:
1. Restrictions The data are available without restrictions, for not-for-profit purposes. 2. Confidentiality In accordance with data protection regulations in participating countries, only anonymous data are available to users. Before depositing data to NSD, each national team is responsible for checking their data with confidentiality in mind and to undertake the necessary measures to ensure anonymity of the data files and to foresee that anonymity is also maintained after merging of
data files. 3. Bibliographic citations ESS round 1 R Jowell and the Central Co-ordinating Team, European Social Survey 2002/2003: Technical Report, London: Centre for Comparative Social Surveys, City University (2003) ESS round 2 R Jowell and the Central Co-ordinating Team, European Social Survey 2004/2005: Technical Report, London: Centre for Comparative Social Surveys, City University (2005) ESS round 3 R Jowell and the Central Co-ordinating Team, European Social Survey 2006/2007: T
echnical Report, London: Centre for Comparative Social Surveys, City University (2007)
4. Citation requirement Publications based on ESS data should acknowledge this by means of bibliographic citations: a) a bibliographic citation as listed under 3. above b) a reference to Norwegian Social Science Data Services (NSD) as the data archive and distributor of the ESS data. To ensure that such source attributions are captured for social science bibliographic utilities, citations must appear in the footnotes or in the reference section of publications. 5. Disclaimer The Centra
l Co-ordinating Team (CCT) and the producers bear no responsibility for the uses of the
ESS data, or for interpretations or inferences based on these uses. The CCT and the producers accept no liability for indirect, consequential or incidental damages or losses arising from use of the data collection, or from the unavailability of, or break in access to the service for whatever reason. 6. Deposit requirement To provide funding agencies with essential information about the use of ESS data and to facilitate the exchange of information about the ESS, users of ESS data are requi
red to register bibliographic citations of all forms of publications referring to ESS data in the ESS on-line bibliography database at http://ess.nsd.uib.no

fields.value: Christian Religiosity and Voting for West European Radical Right Parties

dsDescriptionValue.value:
We provide data sets and input files for MPlus to replicate the findings from our article in West European Politics (2009).
This article examines the relationship between Christian religiosity and the support for radical right parties in Western Europe. Drawing on theories of electoral choice and on socio-psychological literature largely ignored by scholars of electoral behaviour, it suggests and tests a number of competing hypotheses. The findings demonstrate that while religiosity has few direct effects, and while religious people are neither more nor less hostile towards ethnic minorities and thereby neither m
ore nor less prone to vote for a radical right party, they are not ‘available’ to these parties because they are still firmly attached to Christian Democratic or conservative parties. However, given increasing de-alignment, this ‘vaccine effect’ is likely to become weaker with time.

keywordValue.value: extreme right,radical right, religiosity, western europe

otherGeographicCoverage.value: Austria, Belgium, Switzerland, Denkmark, France, Italy, Netherlands, Norway

files.description: Estimate the model separately for protestants&non-believers/catholics&non-believers (CH/NL). Contains an updated version of the datasets with dummies for protestants/catholics/other christian denominations
files.label: denomination-ch-nl.zip

dataFile.description: Estimate the model separately for protestants&non-believers/catholics&non-believers (CH/NL). Contains an updated version of the datasets with dummies for protestants/catholics/other christian denominations

files.description: This zip file contains eight MPlus input files (one per country) that will let you estimate the model, plus 40 data sets (ASCII, five imputations per country) and eight auxiliary input files). We used MPlus 3.12, which cannot compute indirect effects for multiply imputed data sets. If you want to replicate that part, you will have to modify the input file so that you a) request indirect effects and b) estimate the model for each imputed data set in turn. In other words, you will have to run 40 separate jobs and will have to combine the results from each country according to Rubin's rules.
files.label: main-analysis.zip

dataFile.description: This zip file contains eight MPlus input files (one per country) that will let you estimate the model, plus 40 data sets (ASCII, five imputations per country) and eight auxiliary input files). We used MPlus 3.12, which cannot compute indirect effects for multiply imputed data sets. If you want to replicate that part, you will have to modify the input file so that you a) request indirect effects and b) estimate the model for each imputed data set in turn. In other words, you will have to run 40 separate jobs and will have to combine the results from each country according to Rubin's rules.

files.description: Wording of the indicators for radical right attitudes and religiosity plus additional tables providing details on the measurement level.
files.label: MeasurementModelAndWording.pdf

dataFile.description: Wording of the indicators for radical right attitudes and religiosity plus additional tables providing details on the measurement level.

files.description: Binary data for Austria. You will need to dichotomise the class variable to replicate our results. Here is a fragment of stata code: 	recode gold (1/3=0) (4/10=1) 	ren ddrage_2 age2 	ren ddrage_3 age3 	drop drage gg* _i 	drop lrscale polintr
files.label: xr-at.tab

dataFile.description: Binary data for Austria. You will need to dichotomise the class variable to replicate our results. Here is a fragment of stata code: 	recode gold (1/3=0) (4/10=1) 	ren ddrage_2 age2 	ren ddrage_3 age3 	drop drage gg* _i 	drop lrscale polintr
